body: thanks for your contribution! merged.
thanks @fjros theres a build error that needs fixing first.
thanks @johnnyWalnut for the fix. This API is a constantly moving target. Can you please add a small test to demonstrate the functionality?

:+1: thanks @fjros 

please can you start the ICLA process if you plan on contributing more code, that way we don't have to deal with it later.
Sure! I'll send the agreement next week. Thanks @tonybaloney  :-)

Hi @tonybaloney, that was the intended behavior of this PR :) I mean, this is something that I experience on a regular basis: Cannot list sizes of new EC2 regions because their pricing isn't available on libcloud.

I haven't found the time to look into the solution, just to create this test that shows the issue. Can try to fix it in a few days, but any suggestion would be welcome ;-)
👍  this will go into 2.0.1

thanks @t-tran for the contribution, please check the test output

```
======================================================================
ERROR: test_create_node_in_location (libcloud.test.compute.test_hostvirtual.HostVirtualTest)
----------------------------------------------------------------------
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/home/travis/build/apache/libcloud/libcloud/test/compute/test_hostvirtual.py", line 142, in test_create_node_in_location
    location = self.driver.list_locations()[1]
  File "/home/travis/build/apache/libcloud/libcloud/compute/drivers/hostvirtual.py", line 89, in list_locations
    dc = result[k]
TypeError: list indices must be integers, not dict
```
ICLA submitted :-)
Yes, sure i am going to add a test in the next few days..

Nice cleanups! A few lint errors left.

Tried example_openstack.py as I would be interested to use libcloud for Openstack Swift: we currently use libcloud for Google Cloud Storage but python-swiftclient for Openstack Swift (hosted on OVH).

We currently authenticate using Keystone v2: https://docs.openstack.org/developer/python-swiftclient/client-api.html#keystone-v2. This requires an auth url (https://auth.cloud.ovh.net/v2.0/), user, key, tenant name and auth version (2). Why does libcloud require a base url? I don't know what it is. Also not sure why the tenant id is not in the example.

Anyway, with or without valid credentials and with or without a base url, `python demos/example_openstack.py` says:

```
[<NodeLocation: id=0, name=, country=, driver=OpenStack>]
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "demos/example_openstack.py", line 15, in <module>
    pprint(con.list_images())
  File ".../libcloud/libcloud/compute/drivers/openstack.py", line 282, in list_images
    self.connection.request('/images/detail').object, ex_only_active)
  File ".../libcloud/libcloud/common/openstack.py", line 223, in request
    raw=raw)
  File ".../libcloud/libcloud/common/base.py", line 536, in request
    action = self.morph_action_hook(action)
  File ".../libcloud/libcloud/common/openstack.py", line 290, in morph_action_hook
    self._populate_hosts_and_request_paths()
  File ".../libcloud/libcloud/common/openstack.py", line 324, in _populate_hosts_and_request_paths
    osa = osa.authenticate(**kwargs)  # may throw InvalidCreds
  File ".../libcloud/libcloud/common/openstack_identity.py", line 1029, in authenticate
    method='POST')
  File ".../libcloud/libcloud/common/base.py", line 637, in request
    response = responseCls(**kwargs)
  File ".../libcloud/libcloud/common/base.py", line 157, in __init__
    message=self.parse_error())
libcloud.common.exceptions.BaseHTTPError: {"error": {"message": "get_version_v2() got an unexpected keyword argument 'auth'", "code": 400, "title": "Bad Request"}}
```

Am I doing something wrong? Is this the wrong pull request to look at? I don't really know what I'm doing except that python-swiftclient works and libcloud does not appear to work.

Quentin, I agree this needs work.

Thanks for the feedback.

> Anyway, with or without valid credentials and with or without a base url, python

- Fix Kili driver
- Fix get_container in kubernetes container driver
- Fix utilis.decorators which is used by vsphere failing on generic exceptions

@fjros did you mean to close this

Hi @tonybaloney!! #1060 was my attempt to remove all warnings detected by sphinx-build. But I soon realized two things:
- there're way more sphinx warnings widespread throughout libcloud than I can handle
- I'm not that good at dealing with sphinx issues ;)

So I deleted this branch. Instead, I created #1061 to not treat sphinx warnings as errors temporarily. In that way pending PRs like #1056, #1058 or #1062 may progress. Atm all builds fail consistently due to this documentation issue.

What's the rationale of checking the coverage of the tests themselves?
@fjros What makes you say that the coverage of the tests is checked?

@pquentin coveralls is failing in this PR because the coverage of `test_ec2.py` has decreased:
https://coveralls.io/builds/11760946

Ah, right.

A simple fix is to use `with pytest.raises()` instead of the `try ... except ... else` hack and remove the unused methods. It would be interesting to know why they are unused (a path that was covered no longer is?), so maybe tracking the coverage of tests is actually valuable.

Coverage decreased (-0.03%) to 88.193% when pulling **93c626a5cf7caec0a3c052b107fd1b3a45f9fc53 on johnnyWalnut:fix_docker_tls** into **7ec025e2dbc77f19ececd783633a7ff3ef27871f on apache:trunk**.

I believe that a user is good to have the ability to create a docker tls connection without to set the environment variables as libcloud propose:

http://libcloud.readthedocs.io/en/latest/other/ssl-certificate-validation.html#using-a-custom-ca-certificate

ex.
```
       from libcloud.container.providers import get_driver 
   ...: key = '/home/johnny/Documents/kleidia/key.pem'
   ...: cert = '/home/johnny/Documents/kleidia/cert.pem'
   ...: ca_cert = '/home/johnny/Documents/kleidia/ca.pem'
   ...: 
   ...: driver = get_driver('docker')
   ...: d = driver(key_file=key, cert_file=cert,host='http://188.226.146.250', port=4243, 
        ca_cert=ca_cert)
```
If you also agree, i would be glad to add a test!



If you also agree
Also, sorry, I don't use AWS, which is why I can't comment on the actual fixes here.
